intro: Micranthemum pilosum, commonly known as hairy watermint, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant native to the Americas. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, marshes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. Its flowers are tiny, greenish-white, and arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in water gardens. Micranthemum pilosum is also valued for its ability to provide habitat for aquatic invertebrates and fish.
